question_sentence: Scott Peterson was resentenced for killing his wife and unborn child in 2002. Why was his previous sentence, capital punishment, overturned?
choices: A judge’s opposition to the death penalty
Improper screening of jurors for bias

question_sentence: What is Pantone’s 2022 color of the year?
While roaming across a crater on the far side of the moon, a rover discovered a mysterious object shaped like a:
Medina Spirit, the disputed winner of the 2021 Kentucky Derby, died Monday due to a:
Per the Labor Department, how many jobs were available for each unemployed person in the U.S. in October?
Which golfer announced this week they’re returning to compete in the PNC Championship?
The CEO of which airline announced their retirement?
A Texas substitute teacher was asked to leave early after singing which Britney Spears hit on a karaoke machine?
A Massachusetts company baked the largest pot brownie. How heavy was it?
The Canadian government banned which practice this week?
What technology does Vice President Kamala Harris reportedly shun due to security concerns?
evidence: Her fears are not unfounded with Wired reporting that Bluetooth is ‘serially insecure’, with issues ranging from ‘low-grade privacy risks to major security breaches’

question_sentence: How many years in prison was deposed civil leader of Myanmar Aung San Suu Kyi sentenced to this week?
evidence: Suu Kyi faces 11 charges in total, all of which she has denied and are ‘widely condemned as unjust’, according to the BBC

question_sentence: How many words and phrases can a dog recognise on average, according to a new study?
evidence: Researchers found that the words most often understood were treat, breakfast, dinner, garbage, poo, ball and squirrel

question_sentence: Which country became the first to introduce a national working week shorter than five days?
evidence: From 2022 government employees will work from 7.30am-3.30pm Monday to Thursday, while Friday will be a half day

question_sentence: How did Finnish prime minister Sanna Marin break her country's Covid guidelines last weekend?
choices: Throwing a party in her office
Going clubbing after exposure to Covid-19
Failing to wear a mask on public transport
Failing to show her Covid pass at a bar
evidence: Marin apologised for clubbing until 4am on Saturday night, hours after her foreign minister had tested positive

question_sentence: Which team won the Women’s FA Cup final at Wembley?
evidence: Chelsea beat Arsenal 4 - 0 in the final to clinch victory

question_sentence: Lawyers representing the victims of the 2017 Rohingya genocide have launched a lawsuit against which social media giant over hate speech on its platform?
evidence: The group alleges that Facebook’s algorithms promoted hate speech against the Rohingya, contributing to a ‘campaign of violence’ described by one UN human rights chief as as ‘a textbook example of ethnic cleansing’

question_sentence: What term will no longer be used by four UK broadcasters after it was judged to be outdated?
evidence: The BBC, ITV, Channel 4 and Channel 5 will no longer use the acronym, used to describe black, Asian and minority ethnic people, after an industry watchdog found it was used to ‘hide failings in the representation of specific ethnic groups’

question_sentence: Which country is the best prepared for a future pandemic, according to a new report?
evidence: The 2021 Global Health Security Index found that the US would be the most able to repond to another health crisis, followed by Australia and Finland. The UK came in seventh place

question_sentence: How far back in time will the James Webb Space Telescope be able to see when it is launched later this month?
evidence: The telescope, which has been jointly developed by Nasa, the European Space Agency and the Canadian Space Agency, will be launched on 22 December after years of delays

question_sentence: The Biden administration announced a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics. In what city are the Games set to take place?
evidence: Though US athletes will still compete, the Biden administration is joining other select countries in not sending an official delegation to the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing in protest of human rights violations in the country’s Xinjiang province.

question_sentence: This social media company recently rolled out a “Take a Break” tool, which deters people from spending endless hours scrolling on the platform.
evidence: The Instagram feature launched the same week that the company’s head, Adam Mosseri, testified at a Senate hearing over the app’s effects on mental health.

question_sentence: Which major US city announced that all private sector employers there will be required to implement a Covid-19 vaccine mandate? This new directive means all employees working in the city must be vaccinated, and it’s the first major city-wide mandate of its kind.
evidence: New York City’s mayor Bill de Blasio announced the mandate, and companies are required to implement the new policy by December 27.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a bipartisan bill authorizing $770 billion in funding for what critical priority?
evidence: The bill, known as the National Defense Authorization Act, is part of annual legislation that sets the policy agenda and provides funding for the Department of Defense.

question_sentence: Which country just appointed a new leader, marking a major changing of the guard for one of the world’s largest economies?
evidence: Germany voted in Olaf Scholz as its new chancellor, replacing Angela Merkel, who held the position for 16 years.

question_sentence: Dictionary.com has announced its Word of the Year that they say encompasses the defining events of 2021.  What is it?
evidence: Dictionary.com’s word of the year is allyship, a word that the company says “acts as a powerful prism through which to view the defining events and experiences of 2021” – from the social justice causes to those serving the front lines of the pandemic.

question_sentence: Which recent New York City event may provide an early look into the transmissibility of the Omicron coronavirus variant, according to CDC experts?
evidence: CDC Director Dr. Rochelle Walensky said that Anime NYC, a November convention with an estimated attendance of 53,000, could be pivotal in understanding the variant’s earliest spread in the US.

question_sentence: Which international leader is embroiled in controversy following allegations that two social events were held in one of the country’s main government buildings in the days leading up to Christmas last year?
evidence: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his team have received strong condemnation after information and videos emerged seeming to reference Christmas parties that took place at 10 Downing Street when the country was under strict coronavirus restrictions.

question_sentence: Tokyo’s Metropolitan government will begin a system that effectively allows same-sex marriage starting next year. What is the only country in Asia where same-sex marriage is currently legal?
evidence: Japan’s capital city would join Taiwan, the only other place in Asia that has fully legalized same-sex marriage.

question_sentence: Marc Short, a member of the former Trump administration, is cooperating with the House committee investigating the January 6 Capitol riot. The committee hopes to use Short to gain insight into the actions of which major Trump White House figure, whom Short served under?
evidence: Short was the chief of staff to former Vice President Mike Pence.
